content: Four Thousand Men Fed
In those days, when there was again a large crowd and they had nothing to eat,  summoned His disciples and *said to them,
And His disciples replied to Him, “Where will anyone be able  bread here in  desolate place to satisfy these people?”
And He was asking them,  And they said, “Seven.”

And He *directed the people to recline on the ground; and taking the seven loaves, He gave thanks and broke them, and started giving them to His disciples to serve, and they served them to the people.
They also had a few small fish; and after He had blessed them, He told  to serve these as well.
And they ate and were satisfied; and they picked up seven large baskets  of what was left over of the broken pieces.
About four thousand men were ; and He dismissed them.
And immediately He got into the boat with His disciples and came to the region of Dalmanutha.
And the Pharisees came out and began to argue with Him, demanding from Him a sign from heaven, to test Him.
Sighing deeply in His spirit, He *said,
And leaving them, He again embarked and went away to the other side.
And  had forgotten to take bread, and did not have more than one loaf in the boat with them.
And He was giving orders to them, saying,
And they  to discuss with one another  that they had no bread.
And Jesus, aware of this, *said to them,  They *said to Him, “Twelve.” And they *said to Him, “Seven.”
And He was saying to them,
And they *came to Bethsaida. And  *brought a man who was blind to Jesus and *begged Him to touch him.
Taking the man who was blind by the hand, He brought him out of the village; and after spitting in his eyes and laying His hands on him, He asked him,
And he looked up and said, “I see people, for I see  like trees, walking around.”
Then again He laid His hands on his eyes; and he looked intently and was restored, and  to see everything clearly.
And He sent him to his home, saying,
Peter’s Confession of Christ
Jesus went out, along with His disciples, to the villages of Caesarea Philippi; and on the way He questioned His disciples, saying to them,
They told Him, saying, “John the Baptist; and others  Elijah; and others, one of the prophets.”
And He  questioning them:  Peter answered and *said to Him, “You are the Christ.”
And He warned them to tell no one about Him.
And He began to teach them that the Son of Man must suffer many things and be rejected by the elders and the chief priests and the scribes, and be killed, and after three days rise .
And He was stating the matter plainly. And Peter took Him aside and began to rebuke Him.
But turning around and seeing His disciples, He rebuked Peter and *said,
And He summoned the crowd together with His disciples, and said to them,
